Posts.EditableText:
Luis uploaded a new version to the web site a few days, and I uploaded a new desktop version yesterday (if you want to check if you have that version, it has a size of 31,665,292 bytes).

With the desktop, I have successfully published a game, and uploaded it to textadventures.co.uk, and tested that it does play. On the web version, I have created a new gamebook, and confirmed it does play from the editor.

I _think_ this should have sorted the outstanding issues, but please let me know if not. I apologise for this not being as slick as it might be, but we are still learning how to do this, and it will probably be a while before we know all the potential pitfalls.

I am aware that some people have had problems installing/running the desktop version. This seems to be an issue for specific people, and has cropped up occasionally over the years. There are some suggestions on this page:
http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/problems.html
Posts.HTML:
Luis uploaded a new version to the web site a few days, and I uploaded a new desktop version yesterday (if you want to check if you have that version, it has a size of 31,665,292 bytes).

With the desktop, I have successfully published a game, and uploaded it to textadventures.co.uk, and tested that it does play. On the web version, I have created a new gamebook, and confirmed it does play from the editor.

I think this should have sorted the outstanding issues, but please let me know if not. I apologise for this not being as slick as it might be, but we are still learning how to do this, and it will probably be a while before we know all the potential pitfalls.

I am aware that some people have had problems installing/running the desktop version. This seems to be an issue for specific people, and has cropped up occasionally over the years. There are some suggestions on this page:
http://docs.textadventures.co.uk/quest/problems.html

Posts.EditableText: There are no plans at the moment. Why do you want an update?
Posts.HTML: There are no plans at the moment. Why do you want an update?

Posts.EditableText: jmnevil54 is using the new web version and it sounds like it won't let them play or publish games.
Posts.HTML: jmnevil54 is using the new web version and it sounds like it won't let them play or publish games.
